titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 229
CWG14261

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 6

body.p:
War Department,
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, May 22d, 1863.
Special Orders,
No. 229 }
Extract.

12. Surgeon L. L. Pinkerton, 11th Kentucky Cavalry, is hereby mustered out and discharged the service of the United States to date February 28th 1863. to which date he has been paid, he having since his date of muster in, rendered but little service to the Government, in consequence of being absent from his command on account of sickness.

1. 2. 3. 4 5. 6
Surg. Pinkertons
Com. dated Sept. 18. 1862
11 Ky Cavy

13. Asst. Surgeon J. T. Rogers, 11th Kentucky Cavalry, is hereby discharged the service from date of his appoinrtment by the Governor, he having refused to be mustered into the service of the United States.

1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6.
Asst. Surg. Robert
com issued Sept. 18. 1862

By order of the Secretary of War:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
(W. C)
Surgn Pinkerton and Asst. Surg. Rogers
